hints.content:
##Rectangles

A rectangle is a quadrilateral with $4$ [[☃ explanation 2]]. 

[[☃ explanation 3]]

options.explanation:
We call a corner a right angle if we can fit a little square perfectly inside it.

Here is an example of a shape with $2$ right angles: 

![A shape with 4 sides. Two corners are labeled Right angle and 2 corners are labeled Not a right angle.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f8081758208a0824fab2ae3e0aa5470ed9d0053e)

![3 shapes with 4 sides and 4 right angles. One shape has 4 equal sides.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/7e147fee7573364cbf9e77ce6425d1c60f1ca278)

Yes, a square is also a rectangle, because all $4$ angles are right angles and the opposite sides are equal.

hints.content: Which of the shapes is a quadrilateral with $4$ right angles?

The following shapes are rectangles:  

 | | 
- | - | -
![A shape with 4 equal sides and 4 right angles.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/90250ac9b213936173c30a7a4a7d930c0292c821) |![A shape with 4 sides and 4 right angles.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c691db129fcc24e48433f15e9acf07457681a598)

[[☃ explanation 2]]

options.explanation:
Yes, it is!  

A rectangle is a quadrilateral with four right angles.

Squares are quadrilaterals. Squares have four right angles.

So, squares are rectangles!
options.showPrompt: Isn't the left one a square?

question.content:
**Which of the following shapes are rectangles?**

[[☃ radio 2]]

choices.content: ![A shape with 4 equal sides and 4 right angles.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/90250ac9b213936173c30a7a4a7d930c0292c821)
![A shape with 4 sides and no right angles.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/70131da8ab81cb8f9e651cc28c595005b70835b1)
![A shape with an open gap in one side.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/a6a6a078903da40dc4d940ffc9957df6c5011cd8)
